# Simple plots using ggplot2  

Plotting a histogram  

--
.panelset.sideways[
```{r include=FALSE}
hist_panel_names <- c(
  source = "R Code",
  output = "Histogram"
)
```

```{r panelset = hist_panel_names, out.width = '50%'}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_histogram(aes(mean_ALL))
```
]

class: center, middle

# Anatomy of a Ggplot

---
# Graphing Template

```{r eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = <DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(mapping = aes(<MAPPINGS>))
```
--
```{r eval = FALSE}
ggplot(<DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(aes(<MAPPINGS>))
```

---
# A Simple Histogram

```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_histogram(aes(mean_ALL))
```
---
# Making Improvements

.panelset.sideways[
```{r include=FALSE}
density_panel_names <- c(
  source = "R Code",
  output = "Density Plot"
)
```

```{r panelset = density_panel_names, out.width = '50%'}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_density(aes(mean_ALL))
```
]
---
--
```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_histogram(aes(mean_ALL)) #<<
```
--
```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_density(aes(mean_ALL)) #<<
```
---
# How similar are ALL and AML? 

.panelset.sideways[
```{r include=FALSE}
scatter_panel_names <- c(
  source = "R Code",
  output = "Scatter Plot"
)
```

```{r panelset = scatter_panel_names, out.width = '50%'}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_point(aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML)) 
```
]
---
# Emphasizing Trends

.panelset.sideways[
```{r include=FALSE}
linear_panel_names <- c(
  source = "R Code",
  output = "Regression Plot"
)
```

```{r panelset = linear_panel_names, out.width = '50%', message = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_point(aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML))  +
  geom_smooth(aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML), method = "lm")
```
]
---
# Inheritance
--
```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects) +
  geom_point(aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML)) + #<<
  geom_smooth(aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML), method = "lm") #<<
```
--
```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects, aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML)) + #<<
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") 
```


# Layering

```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects, aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML)) +
```

```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```
---
# Layering

```{r out.width = '50%', warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
ggplot(golub_subjects, aes(mean_ALL, mean_AML)) +

```

# Plotting Challenge

```{r, fig.height = 5, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(filter(proteins, length > mean(length)), aes(length, mass)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Length",
       y = "Mass",
       title = "Plotting Protein Length versus Mass",
       subtitle = "Just for proteins that are longer than average",
       caption = "Data Source|Uniprot") +
  theme_bw()
```
